diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.description: Cholera is a potentially epidemic and life-threatening bacterial disease that is caused by Vibrio cholerae. It is typically transmitted through contaminated water or food. Symptoms can include severe watery diarrhea, vomiting, and dehydration.

diseases.name: Intestinal infection due to other Vibrio
diseases.description: This category is for infections caused by Vibrio species other than V. cholerae.

diseases.name: Intestinal infection due to Vibrio parahaemolyticus
diseases.description: Usually associated with consumption of raw or undercooked seafood.

diseases.name: Intestinal infections due to other Vibrio, unspecified
diseases.description: A long description that spans multiple lines and needs to be correctly associated with 1A0Z.

diseases.name: Malignant neoplasm of lip
diseases.description: This is a description for malignant neoplasm of lip, also known as lip cancer. It often appears as a sore on the lip that does not heal. Exclusions: skin cancer of lip (Block X)

diseases.name: Malignant neoplasm of base of tongue
diseases.description: Description for base of tongue cancer. This can be aggressive.

diseases.name: Malignant neoplasms, stated or presumed to be primary, of specified sites, unspecified
diseases.description: This is a catch-all description for primary malignant neoplasms of specified sites but not further detailed.

chapter_title: Diseases of the blood or blood-forming organs
